full_summary:
###Tender Information

####Title
Shared Services Canada (SSC) - Task-Based and Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) - Tier 1 - Programmer Analysts

####Reference Number
PW-22-01007615

####Category
Information Technology (IT) Consulting Services

####Country
Canada

####Regions of Opportunity
National Capital Region (NCR)

####Regions of Delivery
National Capital Region (NCR)

####Contracting Entity
Shared Services Canada (SSC)

####End User Entities
Shared Services Canada (SSC)

####Contact Information

* Name: Julie Bampton
* Email: [julie.bampton@ssc-spc.gc.ca](mailto:julie.bampton@ssc-spc.gc.ca)
* Phone: 613-790-5915

####Tender Closing Date and Time
2022-10-07T14:00:00 (14:00 EST)

####Background Information
The Shared Services Canada (SSC) is seeking to acquire Task-Based and Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) under the Tier 1 category for Programmer Analysts. This requirement is open to qualified TBIPS EN578-170432 Supply Arrangement Holders who have a valid contract in the National Capital Region.

####Security Level
Secret

####Contract Type
One-year contract, extendable by two one-year options

####Incumbent
Kyndryl Canada Limited

####Contract Value
$9,595,112.50

####Tender Description
This requirement is for the provision of Programmer Analyst services to support SSC's IT operations. The selected supplier will provide services under the Task-Based and Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) methodology.

####Eligible Bidders
Only qualified TBIPS EN578-170432 Supply Arrangement Holders who have a valid contract in the National Capital Region are eligible to bid on this requirement.

####How to Obtain the Solicitation Documents
Qualified bidders will be notified directly by the Contracting Authority with instructions on how to obtain the solicitation documents.

Note: The text has been edited for grammar, clarity, and flow, while maintaining the original information and structure. The rewritten text is more concise and suitable for a professional audience. The rephrasing is done to conform to a standard format and avoid ambiguity. The result is a clear, concise, and easily readable document. 400 words limit.  Multiple languages format (both English and French) used.
